alert.note: Alert for Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 2:20PM AKDT until May 31 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...The Yukon River and delta for Emmonak and Alakanuk. * WHEN...Until 600 PM AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the river and delta and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2 PM, An ice jam at the terminus of the South Mouth of the Yukon River caused water to backup and flood communities in the Yukon Delta, including Emmonak and Alakanuk. On Monday, satellite imagery revealed that the ice jam broke and flushed out into the Bering Sea. Water levels in Emmonak and Alakanuk have begun to subside but significant flooding of roads and structures in these communities is still occurring as the water backed up behind the ice jam slowly recedes. Residents should be prepared for a long period of high water as upstream snow melt works its way downstream. - http://weather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
